action.action-desc: Mrs. Lesko introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To express the sense of Congress regarding State choice in the observation of daylight saving time.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Don’t Mess with Arizona Act.

section.header: Sense of Congress regarding State choice in observation of daylight saving time
section.text: It is the sense of Congress that Arizona, and any other State that has exempted itself from the provisions of section 3(a) of the Uniform Time Act of 1966 (15 U.S.C. 260a(a)), as in effect on March 15, 2022, should be able to—

paragraph.text: continue to observe permanent standard time; and
elect to observe daylight saving time in the future.
